    • Field Detail

      • SERVER_HOST

        public static final java.lang.String SERVER_HOST
        Optional. A hostname or an IP address of the server ("localhost" by default). It assumes that there is a single endpoint that is given by DNS or a load balancer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String SERVER_PORT
        Optional. A port number of the server (50051 by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_PRIVILEGED_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String SERVER_PRIVILEGED_PORT
        Optional. A port number of the server for privileged services (50052 by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERT_HOLDER_ID

        public static final java.lang.String CERT_HOLDER_ID
        Required. The holder ID of a certificate. It must be configured for each private key and unique in the system.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERT_VERSION

        public static final java.lang.String CERT_VERSION
        Optional. The version of the certificate (1 by default). Use another bigger integer if you need to change your private key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERT_PATH

        public static final java.lang.String CERT_PATH
        Required. The path of the certificate file in PEM format.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERT_PEM

        public static final java.lang.String CERT_PEM
        Required if cert_path is empty. PEM-encoded certificate data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIVATE_KEY_PATH

        public static final java.lang.String PRIVATE_KEY_PATH
        Required. The path of a corresponding private key file in PEM format to the certificate.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIVATE_KEY_PEM

        public static final java.lang.String PRIVATE_KEY_PEM
        Required if private_key_path is empty. PEM-encoded private key data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TLS_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String TLS_ENABLED
        Optional. A flag to enable TLS communication for Ledger (false by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PATH

        public static final java.lang.String TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PATH
        Optional. A custom CA root certificate (file path) for TLS communication for Ledger. If the issuing certificate authority is known to the client, it can be empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PEM

        public static final java.lang.String TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PEM
        Optional. A custom CA root certificate (PEM data) for TLS communication for Ledger. If the issuing certificate authority is known to the client, it can be empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUTHORIZATION_CREDENTIAL

        public static final java.lang.String AUTHORIZATION_CREDENTIAL
        Optional. An authorization credential for Ledger. (e.g. authorization: Bearer token) If this is given, clients will add "authorization: [credential]" http/2 header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE

        public static final java.lang.String MODE
        Optional. A client mode. CLIENT OR INTERMEDIARY. CLIENT by default. In INTERMEDIARY mode, this client receives a signed serialized request from another client, and sends it to a server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROXY_SERVER

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String PROXY_SERVER
        Deprecated. 
        Experimental. Proxy server. Proxy feature is deprecated and will be removed in release 4.0.0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_ENABLED
        Optional. A flag to enable auditor (false by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_HOST

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_HOST
        Optional. A hostname or an IP address of the auditor ("localhost" by default). It assumes that there is a single endpoint that is given by DNS or a load balancer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_PORT
        Optional. A port number of the auditor (40051 by default).

        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_PRIVILEGED_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_PRIVILEGED_PORT
        Optional. A port number of the auditor for privileged services (40052 by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_TLS_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_TLS_ENABLED
        Optional. A flag to enable TLS communication for Auditor (false by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PATH

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PATH
        Optional. A custom CA root certificate (file path) for TLS communication for Auditor. If the issuing certificate authority is known to the client, it can be empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PEM

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PEM
        Optional. A custom CA root certificate (PEM data) for TLS communication for Auditor. If the issuing certificate authority is known to the client, it can be empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_AUTHORIZATION_CREDENTIAL

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_AUTHORIZATION_CREDENTIAL
        Optional. An authorization credential for Auditor. (e.g. authorization: Bearer token) If this is given, clients will add "authorization: [credential]" http/2 header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUDITOR_LINEARIZABLE_VALIDATION_CONTRACT_ID

        public static final java.lang.String AUDITOR_LINEARIZABLE_VALIDATION_CONTRACT_ID
        Optional. The ID of ValidateLedger contract ("validate-ledger" by default). It is used for the linearizable validation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
